title: Frederick Douglass National Historic Site: Suggested Reading
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Professional Development     Suggested Reading                Suggested Reading       National Park Service Publications   Blassingame, John. The Life and Times of Frederick Douglass. 1892.      Speeches and Other Writings by Frederick Douglass Frederick Douglass Documents on TeachingAmericanHistory.org (online resource). The Frederick Douglass Papers at the Library of Congress (online resource). Andrews, William L. (ed.) The Oxford Frederick Douglass Reader. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1996. Frederick Douglass and the Black Liberation Movement: The North Star of American Blacks. New York: Garland Publishing, Inc., 2000.                Frederick Douglass   Frederick Douglass was a runaway slave, abolitionist, equal rights advocate, and statesman.          Cedar Hill   Cedar Hill was the name of Frederick Douglass's estate in Anacostia.          Bring Douglass to Life! Education   Find lesson plans, distance learning programs, suggested reading lists, opportunities for professional development, and more.
